structure.unit: ARTICLE IX. WELLS (OPEN IRRIGATION HOLES) IN AGRICULTURAL FIELDS OPEN TO PUBLIC

law.catch_line: Thefts of plants and fruits and trespass.

text.section:
Sec. 21-118. Thefts of plants and fruits and trespass.
It is unlawful for any person, with the intent to injure or defraud, to take, carry away, or damage any plants, fruits, plant products, or nursery stock contained within any nursery or private or public property without the consent of the owner of the property or his agent.
It is unlawful for any person to enter upon the premises of any nursery or upon private or public property with the intent to injure, damage, take or carry away any plant, fruit, plant product or nursery stock, without the written or oral consent of the owner of the property or his agent.
It is unlawful for any person to enter the premises of any plant or fruit nursery, whenever the nursery is not open for business, without the written or oral consent of the owner of the nursery or his agent.
All violations of this section shall be punished as provided by Section 1-5 of the Code of Miami-Dade County.
